name: Mediterranean Orzo Salad
description: Recipe for an easy Mediterranean orzo salad with tomatoes, olives, artichokes and basil - This vegan salad is a great BBQ side dish! :-)
recipeIngredient: 1/2  cup black olives (I used about 15 black olives)
1/3 cup sun dried tomatoes in oil (I used about 5 dried tomatoes)

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the tofu into cubes and marinate for at least an hour in a mixture of one tablespoon of olive oil and balsamic vinegar and one teaspoon of oregano.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the tofu into cubes and marinate for at least an hour in a mixture of one tablespoon of olive oil and balsamic vinegar and one teaspoon of oregano.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the orzo according to the instructions on the package.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the orzo according to the instructions on the package.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the dressing: Place the sun dried tomatoes, the olive oil, the balsamic vinegar, and the garlic into a food processor and process until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare the dressing: Place the sun dried tomatoes, the olive oil, the balsamic vinegar, and the garlic into a food processor and process until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the cherry tomatoes and the olives in halves. Chop the green onions into rings. Cut the artichokes into small pieces. Chop the basil leaves.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the cherry tomatoes and the olives in halves. Chop the green onions into rings. Cut the artichokes into small pieces. Chop the basil leaves.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the cooked orzo with cold water. Add the salad dressing and stir in the remaining ingredients.
recipeInstructions.name: Rinse the cooked orzo with cold water. Add the salad dressing and stir in the remaining ingredients.

recipeInstructions.text: Season with salt and pepper and let it sit for a while. If you want, add some more balsamic vinegar.
